wiki_catalogs.name: Project Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the Multi-Application-Control-Dashboard project overview. Explain the project's purpose as a unified multi-platform content management system, its key features including study notes, YouTube content, LinkedIn posts, and blog management, target audience, and overall architecture. Document the technology stack (Angular 20 + NestJS 10), system capabilities, and business value proposition. Include project scope, limitations, and future roadmap. Provide high-level system diagrams showing the relationship between frontend, backend, and database components.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication Flow
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the authentication flow implementation. Document the complete user registration and login process, including form validation, API endpoints, and response handling. Explain the local authentication strategy with username/password validation, password hashing with bcrypt, and token generation. Detail the login/logout workflows, session management, and token storage mechanisms. Include practical examples of authentication service usage, component integration, and error handling patterns. Address security considerations, input sanitization, and rate limiting implementation.

wiki_catalogs.name: System Design Patterns
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the system design patterns used in the Multi-Application-Control-Dashboard. Explain the Clean Architecture implementation with clear separation of concerns between presentation, application, domain, and infrastructure layers. Document the Domain-Driven Design principles applied throughout the codebase, including bounded contexts for each module. Detail the microservice-like modular architecture pattern that allows independent scaling and deployment of content management features. Explain the Repository pattern implementation with Mongoose ODM, Strategy pattern for authentication methods, and Decorator pattern for route guards. Include architectural diagrams showing component relationships and data flow patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Study Notes Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the Study Notes Management module. Detail the complete CRUD operations for study notes including creation, editing, deletion, and viewing functionality. Document the study note schema with fields for title, content, category, tags, and metadata. Explain the form component implementation with rich text editing capabilities, category selection, and tag management. Cover the list view with filtering, searching, and sorting capabilities. Detail the view component for displaying individual study notes with formatting preservation. Document the signal store implementation for reactive state management, service layer architecture, and API integration patterns. Include practical examples of note creation workflows, content organization strategies, and user interaction patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Core Entity Schemas
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the core entity schemas in the Multi-Application-Control-Dashboard MongoDB implementation. Detail the User, Role, Permission, and Module schemas including their field definitions, data types, validation rules, and relationships. Document the User schema with status management, role assignments, and module permissions. Explain the Role hierarchy system with RoleType enumeration and permission inheritance. Cover the Permission schema structure and how permissions cascade through roles. Detail the Module schema for dynamic module enable/disable functionality. Include virtual properties, schema transformations, and security considerations. Provide examples of schema relationships and referential integrity patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Store Architecture Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the overall signal store architecture in the Multi-Application-Control-Dashboard. Explain the signal store pattern implementation, reactive state management concepts, and the rationale behind choosing Angular Signals over traditional state management solutions. Document the store composition patterns, state immutability principles, and reactive programming concepts used throughout the application. Detail the integration between signal stores and Angular services, interceptor patterns, and error handling strategies. Include architectural diagrams showing store relationships, data flow patterns, and component-store communication mechanisms. Provide practical examples of store initialization, subscription patterns, and debugging techniques.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the Authentication endpoints. Document all authentication-related endpoints including login, logout, registration, password reset, and token refresh mechanisms. For each endpoint, specify HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, authentication requirements, and error responses. Include detailed parameter descriptions for login credentials, registration data, and JWT token handling. Document the JWT authentication flow, token expiration policies, and refresh token mechanisms. Provide examples of successful authentication responses, common authentication errors, and security considerations. Address session management, CSRF protection, and multi-factor authentication integration points.

wiki_catalogs.name: Study Notes API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed API documentation for Study Notes endpoints. Document all CRUD operations for study notes including creation, editing, categorization, and deletion. Specify HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and validation rules for study note data. Include endpoints for note organization, tagging, search functionality, and content management. Provide examples of study note structures, category hierarchies, and metadata handling. Document note formatting options, attachment management, and collaborative editing features. Address note versioning, sharing permissions, and integration with learning management systems.

wiki_catalogs.name: Getting Started
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive getting started documentation for the Multi-Application-Control-Dashboard. Include prerequisites (Node.js, Angular CLI, Nest CLI, MongoDB), step-by-step installation instructions, environment setup with .env configuration, database initialization, and first run procedures. Document development server startup, build processes, and basic usage examples. Provide troubleshooting for common setup issues and verification steps to ensure proper installation.

wiki_catalogs.name: JWT Token System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive documentation for the JWT token system implementation. Detail JWT token generation, validation, and refresh mechanisms. Explain the JWT strategy configuration, token expiration handling, and payload structure. Document the JWT auth guard implementation, token extraction from headers, and automatic user injection via decorators. Include practical examples of token usage in controllers, middleware integration, and secure endpoint protection. Address token security best practices, storage recommendations, and token lifecycle management.

wiki_catalogs.name: Frontend Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the Angular frontend architecture. Explain the component hierarchy starting from the Layout Component down to feature-specific components. Document the Signal-based reactive programming approach using Angular Signals instead of traditional Observables. Detail the lazy loading strategy implemented through Angular Router configuration. Explain the component communication patterns including parent-child relationships, service-based communication, and signal store integration. Document the responsive design implementation using Tailwind CSS utility classes. Include architectural diagrams showing component tree structure and data flow between components.

wiki_catalogs.name: YouTube Content Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the YouTube Content Management module. Detail the video content management system including video upload, metadata handling, scheduling, and analytics integration. Document the YouTube post schema with fields for video URL, title, description, thumbnail, publish date, and engagement metrics. Explain the form component implementation for video submission with URL validation, metadata extraction, and preview functionality. Cover the list view with video thumbnails, status indicators, scheduling information, and analytics data. Detail the view component for displaying video details with embedded players and statistics. Document the dual-schema approach (post and content schemas), service layer for external YouTube API integration, and signal store for state management. Include practical examples of video workflow processes, scheduling strategies, and analytics monitoring.

wiki_catalogs.name: Content Document Schemas
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the content document schemas used throughout the Multi-Application-Control-Dashboard platform. Document the StudyNote schema with categorization, tagging, and content organization fields. Detail the YouTubePost and YouTubeContent schemas including video metadata, analytics data, and publishing workflows. Explain the LinkedInPost schema structure for social media content management. Cover the BlogPost schema with article creation, publishing workflows, and content management features. Include field validation rules, data types, and relationship patterns with core entities. Document content lifecycle management, status tracking, and search optimization strategies. Provide examples of content creation, modification, and archival processes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication Store
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the authentication store implementation using Angular Signals. Explain the authentication state management including user session data, JWT token handling, login/logout state transitions, and role-based access state. Document the store's reactive properties for user authentication status, loading states, and error conditions. Detail the integration with authentication services, route guards, and interceptor patterns. Include practical examples of authentication state subscriptions, login form handling, and logout workflows. Address security considerations, token refresh mechanisms, and session persistence strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: User Management API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed API documentation for User Management endpoints. Document all user-related CRUD operations including user creation, retrieval, updates, and deletion. Specify HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and validation rules for user data. Include endpoints for user profile management, status updates, role assignments, and password changes. Document search and filtering capabilities, pagination parameters, and bulk operations. Provide examples of user data structures, success responses, and error scenarios including duplicate email validation and permission errors. Address user activation workflows, account suspension procedures, and data export capabilities.

wiki_catalogs.name: YouTube API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for YouTube content management endpoints. Document video upload, processing, and management operations including metadata handling, thumbnail management, and content scheduling. Specify HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and validation rules for YouTube content data. Include endpoints for video processing workflows, analytics integration, engagement metrics, and content moderation. Provide examples of video upload processes, metadata structures, and processing status tracking. Document video optimization, transcoding workflows, and quality management. Address YouTube API integration, content ownership verification, and compliance with platform policies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Architecture Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the Multi-Application-Control-Dashboard system. Describe the high-level design patterns including Clean Architecture, Domain-Driven Design principles, and microservice-like modular structure. Document the frontend architecture with Angular Signals, reactive programming, and component hierarchy. Explain the backend architecture with NestJS modules, dependency injection, and layered architecture. Include system boundaries, component interactions, data flows, and integration patterns. Address security architecture, authentication flow, and authorization mechanisms.

wiki_catalogs.name: Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed RBAC documentation covering the three-tier role hierarchy (Super Admin, Admin, Viewer) and permission system. Document role creation, permission assignment, and module access controls. Explain the role guard implementation, permission decorators, and module access validation. Detail the hierarchical permission structure, inheritance patterns, and access control enforcement. Include practical examples of role-based route protection, component visibility controls, and dynamic menu generation. Address role management workflows, permission auditing, and security policy implementation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Backend Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the NestJS backend architecture. Explain the module-based architecture with clear separation of concerns across authentication, user management, content modules, and administrative features. Document the dependency injection system and how services are registered and injected throughout the application. Detail the layered architecture pattern with clear boundaries between controllers, services, DTOs, and schemas. Explain the middleware pipeline, interceptors, and global exception handling. Document the database abstraction layer using Mongoose ODM and the repository pattern implementation. Include architectural diagrams showing module dependencies and request/response flow patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: LinkedIn Content Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the LinkedIn Content Management module. Detail the social media post management system including content creation, publishing workflows, and engagement tracking. Document the LinkedIn post schema with fields for post content, media attachments, publication status, publish date, and engagement metrics. Explain the form component implementation for creating professional posts with text editor, media upload, and scheduling capabilities. Cover the list view with post status indicators, publication history, and performance analytics. Detail the view component for displaying published posts with engagement statistics and analytics data. Document the service layer for LinkedIn API integration, OAuth authentication, and automated posting workflows. Include practical examples of professional content creation, publishing strategies, and engagement monitoring techniques.

wiki_catalogs.name: Dashboard Store
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the dashboard store architecture covering both user dashboard and admin dashboard state management. Explain the reactive state properties for dashboard statistics, recent activity feeds, module availability, and user-specific data. Document the store's integration with analytics services, module status monitoring, and administrative features. Detail the state composition patterns for different dashboard views, data fetching strategies, and real-time updates. Include examples of dashboard data subscriptions, filter mechanisms, and performance optimization techniques.

wiki_catalogs.name: Role & Permission API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for Role and Permission management endpoints. Document all endpoints for role creation, modification, and deletion, including hierarchical role structures and inheritance patterns. Detail permission management endpoints for assigning, revoking, and querying permissions. Specify HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and validation rules for role and permission data. Include examples of role hierarchies, permission matrices, and access control enforcement. Document dynamic permission evaluation, role-based access control (RBAC) implementation, and permission caching strategies. Address permission validation workflows, role assignment conflicts, and audit trail requirements for administrative actions.

wiki_catalogs.name: LinkedIn API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed API documentation for LinkedIn content management endpoints. Document post creation, publishing, and management operations including content formatting, image handling, and engagement tracking. Specify HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and validation rules for LinkedIn post data. Include endpoints for post scheduling, analytics integration, and engagement metrics. Provide examples of LinkedIn post structures, content formatting options, and publishing workflows. Document LinkedIn API integration, content approval processes, and platform-specific formatting requirements. Address post visibility controls, audience targeting, and compliance with LinkedIn's content policies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication & Authorization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive authentication and authorization documentation for the Multi-Application-Control-Dashboard. Detail the JWT-based authentication system, password hashing with bcrypt, passport strategies (JWT and Local), and role-based access control (RBAC). Document user registration and login flows, session management, token refresh mechanisms, and security best practices. Explain the three-tier role hierarchy (Super Admin, Admin, Viewer), permission system, and module access controls. Include practical examples of guard implementation, decorator usage, and protected route configuration.

wiki_catalogs.name: Security Implementation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Document the comprehensive security implementation including authentication guards, input validation, and security interceptors. Detail the authentication guard workflow, request preprocessing, and response postprocessing. Explain security decorators for user identification and role verification. Document input sanitization, SQL injection prevention, and XSS protection measures. Include CORS configuration, helmet integration, and security middleware setup. Address security best practices, vulnerability mitigation, and compliance considerations. Provide examples of secure API development patterns and defensive programming techniques.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the authentication and authorization system. Explain the dual authentication strategy using JWT tokens and local authentication methods. Document the passport.js integration and custom strategies for different authentication methods. Detail the guard implementation for route protection including JWT authentication guard, role-based access control guards, and module access guards. Explain the token-based session management, refresh token handling, and security considerations. Document the user registration workflow, password hashing with bcrypt, and email verification process. Include security best practices, token storage strategies, and authentication flow diagrams.

wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the Blog Management System. wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive documentation for the content module store implementations including study notes, YouTube, LinkedIn, and blog management stores. Explain the common patterns across content stores, state management for CRUD operations, list management, form state handling, and search/filter functionality. Document the store composition patterns, data normalization strategies, and caching mechanisms. Detail the integration with respective services, error handling patterns, and loading state management. wiki_overview.content:
<blog>

# Multi-Application Control Dashboard - Comprehensive Project Analysis

## 1. Project Introduction

### Purpose Statement
The Multi-Application Control Dashboard is a comprehensive web application platform designed to unify and manage multiple content creation and social media management tools through a single, centralized interface. The system provides integrated solutions for study notes management, YouTube content creation, LinkedIn publishing, and blog post management, all controlled through a robust role-based access control (RBAC) system.

### Core Goals and Objectives
- **Unified Content Management**: Centralize multiple content creation platforms into a single dashboard
- **Role-Based Access Control**: Implement granular permissions for different user types (Super Admin, Admin, Viewer)
- **Modular Architecture**: Support independent module management with enable/disable capabilities
- **Real-time Analytics**: Provide comprehensive insights and metrics across all content platforms
- **Audit Trail**: Maintain detailed logs of all user activities and system changes

### Target Audience
- **Content Creators**: Individuals managing multiple social media and content platforms
- **Marketing Teams**: Organizations requiring coordinated content strategy across platforms
- **Educational Institutions**: Institutions managing study materials and educational content
- **Small to Medium Businesses**: Companies needing unified content management solutions

## 2. Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown

The project follows a modern full-stack architecture with clear separation between frontend and backend concerns:

```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Angular Frontend] --> B[HTTP Client]
    B --> C[NestJS Backend API]
    C --> D[MongoDB Database]
    
    subgraph "Frontend Layer"
        A1[Layout Component]
        A2[Navigation]
        A3[Feature Modules]
        A4[Signal Stores]
    end
    
    subgraph "Backend Layer"
        B1[Auth Module]
        B2[Core Modules]
        B3[Service Layer]
        B4[Data Access Layer]
    end
    
    subgraph "Database Layer"
        C1[User Collection]
        C2[Role Collection]
        C3[Module Collection]
        C4[Content Collections]
    end
```

### Design Patterns

The application implements several key design patterns:

- **Repository Pattern**: Abstracted database operations through service layers
- **Module Pattern**: Independent feature modules with dedicated controllers and services
- **Signal Store Pattern**: Modern state management using NgRx Signals
- **Guard Pattern**: Route protection using Angular route guards
- **Interceptor Pattern**: HTTP request/response modification

### System Relationships

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    Client[Web Client] --> Auth[Authentication Layer]
    Auth --> RBAC[Role-Based Access Control]
    RBAC --> Modules[Module Management]
    Modules --> Services[Service Layer]
    Services --> Database[(MongoDB)]
    
    subgraph "Core Modules"
        StudyNotes[Study Notes]
        YouTube[YouTube Content]
        LinkedIn[LinkedIn Posts]
        Blog[Blogs]
    end
    
    Services --> StudyNotes
    Services --> YouTube
    Services --> LinkedIn
    Services --> Blog
```

### Data Flow Diagrams

```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    participant Client
    participant AuthGuard
    participant AuthService
    participant JWT
    participant API
    participant DB
    
    Client->>+AuthGuard: Request Protected Route
    AuthGuard->>+AuthService: Validate Token
    AuthService->>+JWT: Verify JWT
    JWT-->>-AuthService: Token Valid
    AuthService-->>-AuthGuard: Authenticated
    AuthGuard-->>-Client: Access Granted
    Client->>+API: Make API Request
    API->>+DB: Query Data
    DB-->>-API: Return Results
    API-->>-Client: Response
```

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points

**Backend Bootstrap**
- **File**: `backend/src/main.ts`
- **Purpose**: Application initialization, CORS configuration, global pipes, and server startup
- **Key Features**: Dynamic CORS origin handling, global validation pipe, API prefix configuration

**Frontend Bootstrap**
- **File**: `frontend/src/main.ts`
- **Purpose**: Angular application bootstrapping with zone change detection optimization
- **Key Features**: Streamlined bootstrap process, minimal configuration

### Core Modules

**Main Application Module**
- **File**: `backend/src/app.module.ts`
- **Purpose**: Central module orchestrating all feature modules
- **Structure**: Imports 10+ feature modules including Auth, Users, Roles, Permissions, and content modules

**Authentication Module**
- **File**: `backend/src/auth/auth.module.ts`
- **Purpose**: JWT-based authentication with passport strategies
- **Components**: JWT strategy, local strategy, auth controller, auth service

### Configuration Approach

**Environment Configuration**
- **File**: `backend/.env.example`
- **Purpose**: Centralized environment variables for database, JWT, and CORS settings
- **Security**: Includes production-ready defaults and security recommendations

**Frontend Configuration**
- **File**: `frontend/src/app/app.config.ts`
- **Purpose**: Angular application configuration with interceptors and guards
- **Features**: HTTP interceptors, route guards, dependency injection configuration

### External Dependencies

**Backend Dependencies**
- **Framework**: NestJS 10.x with TypeScript support
- **Database**: MongoDB with Mongoose ODM
- **Authentication**: JWT, Passport.js, bcrypt for password hashing
- **Validation**: Class-validator, class-transformer
- **Security**: CORS, Express middleware

**Frontend Dependencies**
- **Framework**: Angular 20 with modern features
- **State Management**: NgRx Signals for reactive state management
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS with PostCSS
- **Build Tools**: Angular CLI, TypeScript compiler

### Integration Points

**API Integration**
- **Base URL**: `http://localhost:3000/api`
- **Authentication**: JWT token-based authentication
- **CORS**: Development-friendly CORS configuration
- **Error Handling**: Centralized error handling through interceptors

**Component Relationship Diagram**

```mermaid
graph LR
    A[Layout Component] --> B[Navbar Component]
    A --> C[Sidebar Component]
    A --> D[Router Outlet]
    
    B --> E[Auth Store]
    C --> F[Module Store]
    D --> G[Feature Components]
    
    E --> H[Auth Service]
    F --> I[Module Service]
    G --> J[Content Services]
    
    H --> K[API Service]
    I --> K
    J --> K
```

## 4. Key Features

### Functionality Overview

**Multi-Platform Content Management**
- **Study Notes**: Organized note-taking with categorization and tagging
- **YouTube Content**: Video management with analytics and scheduling
- **LinkedIn Publishing**: Professional networking content creation
- **Blog Management**: Full-featured blogging platform with publishing workflows

**Advanced Access Control**
- **Role-Based Permissions**: Three-tier role system (Super Admin, Admin, Viewer)
- **Module-Level Access**: Granular control over individual platform access
- **Route Protection**: Automatic route-level security enforcement

**Administrative Capabilities**
- **User Management**: Complete user lifecycle management
- **Module Administration**: Enable/disable functionality per module
- **Analytics Dashboard**: Comprehensive system usage analytics

### Implementation Highlights

**State Management Architecture**
- **File**: `frontend/src/app/core/store/auth.store.ts`
- **Pattern**: Signal-based reactive state management
- **Features**: Token refresh, user profile management, role-based access checks

**Routing and Navigation**
- **File**: `frontend/src/app/app.routes.ts`
- **Structure**: Nested routing with lazy loading for performance
- **Security**: Route guards for authentication and authorization

**Component Architecture**
- **File**: `frontend/src/app/shared/layouts/layout.component.ts`
- **Design**: Reusable layout component with navigation integration
- **Flexibility**: Modular component structure supporting future expansion

### Feature Architecture Diagram

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Unauthenticated
    Unauthenticated --> Authenticating: Login Attempt
    Authenticating --> Authenticated: Valid Credentials
    Authenticating --> Unauthenticated: Invalid Credentials
    
    Authenticated --> LoadingModules: Initialize App
    LoadingModules --> Dashboard: Modules Loaded
    LoadingModules --> LoadingModules: Module Loading
    
    Dashboard --> StudyNotes: Navigate to Study Notes
    Dashboard --> YouTube: Navigate to YouTube
    Dashboard --> LinkedIn: Navigate to LinkedIn
    Dashboard --> Blog: Navigate to Blog
    Dashboard --> AdminPanel: Navigate to Admin
    
    StudyNotes --> Dashboard: Back to Dashboard
    YouTube --> Dashboard: Back to Dashboard
    LinkedIn --> Dashboard: Back to Dashboard
    Blog --> Dashboard: Back to Dashboard
    AdminPanel --> Dashboard: Back to Dashboard
    
    Authenticated --> Unauthenticated: Logout
    Unauthenticated --> [*]: Application Exit
```

**Security Implementation**
- **File**: `backend/src/auth/guards/role.guard.ts`
- **Mechanism**: Role-based route protection with dynamic permission checking
- **Integration**: Seamless integration with Angular route guards

**Data Persistence Strategy**
- **File**: `backend/src/users/users.module.ts`
- **Approach**: MongoDB with Mongoose schemas for type-safe data operations
- **Scalability**: Document-based storage supporting flexible content structures

---

**Sources:**
- [main.ts](backend/src/main.ts)
- [app.module.ts](backend/src/app.module.ts)
- [main.ts](frontend/src/main.ts)
- [app.config.ts](frontend/src/app/app.config.ts)
- [package.json](backend/package.json)
- [package.json](frontend/package.json)
- [.env.example](backend/.env.example)
- [app.routes.ts](frontend/src/app/app.routes.ts)
- [auth.module.ts](backend/src/auth/auth.module.ts)
- [admin.routes.ts](frontend/src/app/features/admin/admin.routes.ts)
- [layout.component.ts](frontend/src/app/shared/layouts/layout.component.ts)
- [users.module.ts](backend/src/users/users.module.ts)
- [modules.module.ts](backend/src/modules/modules.module.ts)
- [auth.store.ts](frontend/src/app/core/store/auth.store.ts)
- [SETUP_GUIDE.md](SETUP_GUIDE.md)

</blog>
